data_objects.name: linux_kernel_threads
data_objects.desc:
All kernel threads of the trace. As kernel threads are processes, provides
 also process data.
data_objects.summary_desc: All kernel threads of the trace

cols.name: upid
cols.desc: Upid of kernel thread. Alias of |process.upid|.

cols.name: utid
cols.desc: Utid of kernel thread. Alias of |thread.utid|.

cols.name: pid
cols.desc: Pid of kernel thread. Alias of |process.pid|.

cols.name: tid
cols.desc: Tid of kernel thread. Alias of |process.pid|.

cols.name: process_name
cols.desc: Name of kernel process. Alias of |process.name|.

cols.name: thread_name
cols.desc: Name of kernel thread. Alias of |thread.name|.

cols.name: machine_id
cols.desc: Machine id of kernel thread. Alias of |process.machine_id|.

data_objects.name: linux_active_block_io_operations_by_device
data_objects.desc:
View tracking the number of IO operations remaining in the kernel IO queue or
 a block device
data_objects.summary_desc: View tracking the number of IO operations remaining in the kernel IO queue or  a block device

cols.name: ts
cols.desc: timestamp when block_io_start or block_io_done happened

cols.name: ops_in_queue_or_device
cols.desc: the number of IO operations in the kernel queue or the device

cols.name: dev
cols.desc: the device processing the IO operations

functions.name: linux_device_major_id
functions.desc: Extracts the major id from a device id
functions.summary_desc: Extracts the major id from a device id

functions.name: linux_device_minor_id
functions.desc: Extracts the minor id from a device id
functions.summary_desc: Extracts the minor id from a device id

data_objects.name: linux_devfreq_dsu_counter
data_objects.desc:
ARM DSU device frequency counters. This table will only be populated on
 traces collected with "devfreq/devfreq_frequency" ftrace event enabled,
 and from ARM devices with the DSU (DynamIQ Shared Unit) hardware.
data_objects.summary_desc: ARM DSU device frequency counters

cols.name: id
cols.desc: Unique identifier for this counter.

cols.name: ts
cols.desc: Starting timestamp of the counter.

cols.name: dur
cols.desc: Duration in which counter is constant and frequency doesn't chamge.

cols.name: dsu_freq
cols.desc: Frequency in kHz of the device that corresponds to the counter.

data_objects.name: linux_perf_samples_summary_tree
data_objects.desc:
Table summarising the callstacks captured during all
 perf samples in the trace.

 Specifically, this table returns a tree containing all
 the callstacks seen during the trace with `self_count`
 equal to the number of samples with that frame as the
 leaf and `cumulative_count` equal to the number of
 samples with the frame anywhere in the tree.
data_objects.summary_desc: Table summarising the callstacks captured during all  perf samples in the trace

cols.name: id
cols.desc: The id of the callstack. A callstack in this context is a unique set of frames up to the root.

cols.name: parent_id
cols.desc: The id of the parent callstack for this callstack.

cols.name: name
cols.desc: The function name of the frame for this callstack.

cols.name: mapping_name
cols.desc: The name of the mapping containing the frame. This can be a native binary, library, JAR or APK.

cols.name: source_file
cols.desc: The name of the file containing the function.

cols.name: line_number
cols.desc: The line number in the file the function is located at.

cols.name: self_count
cols.desc: The number of samples with this function as the leaf frame.

cols.name: cumulative_count
cols.desc: The number of samples with this function appearing anywhere on the callstack.

data_objects.name: linux_perf_sample_with_counters
data_objects.desc:
Fully denormalized view joining perf samples with their counter values.
 Note: This view has multiple rows per sample (one for each counter).
 Use with caution for large traces as it may impact query performance.
data_objects.summary_desc: Fully denormalized view joining perf samples with their counter values

cols.name: sample_id
cols.desc: The sample ID.

cols.name: ts
cols.desc: Timestamp of the sample.

cols.name: utid
cols.desc: Sampled thread ID.

cols.name: cpu
cols.desc: Core the sampled thread was running on.

cols.name: cpu_mode
cols.desc: Execution state (userspace/kernelspace).

cols.name: callsite_id
cols.desc: Unwound callstack of the sampled thread.

cols.name: unwind_error
cols.desc: Stack unwinding error if any.

cols.name: perf_session_id
cols.desc: Perf session ID.

cols.name: counter_id
cols.desc: Counter ID referencing the counter table.

cols.name: track_id
cols.desc: Track ID for the counter.

cols.name: counter_value
cols.desc: Counter value at this sample point.

data_objects.name: linux_perf_spe_record
data_objects.desc: Contains ARM Statistical Profiling Extension records
data_objects.summary_desc: Contains ARM Statistical Profiling Extension records

cols.name: ts
cols.desc: Timestap when the operation was sampled

cols.name: utid
cols.desc: Thread the operation executed in

cols.name: exception_level
cols.desc: Exception level the instruction was executed in

cols.name: instruction_frame_id
cols.desc: Instruction virtual address

cols.name: operation
cols.desc: Type of operation sampled

cols.name: data_virtual_address
cols.desc: The virtual address accessed by the operation (0 if no memory access was performed)

cols.name: data_physical_address
cols.desc: The physical address accessed by the operation (0 if no memory access was performed)

cols.name: total_latency
cols.desc: Cycle count from the operation being dispatched for issue to the operation being complete.

cols.name: issue_latency
cols.desc: Cycle count from the operation being dispatched for issue to the operation being issued for execution.

cols.name: translation_latency
cols.desc: Cycle count from a virtual address being passed to the MMU for translation to the result of the translation being available.

cols.name: data_source
cols.desc: Where the data returned for a load operation was sourced

cols.name: exception_gen
cols.desc: Operation generated an exception

cols.name: retired
cols.desc: Operation architecturally retired

cols.name: l1d_access
cols.desc: Operation caused a level 1 data cache access

cols.name: l1d_refill
cols.desc: Operation caused a level 1 data cache refill

cols.name: tlb_access
cols.desc: Operation caused a TLB access

cols.name: tlb_refill
cols.desc: Operation caused a TLB refill involving at least one translation table walk

cols.name: not_taken
cols.desc: Conditional instruction failed its condition code check

cols.name: mispred
cols.desc: Whether a branch caused a correction to the predicted program flow

cols.name: llc_access
cols.desc: Operation caused a last level data or unified cache access

cols.name: llc_refill
cols.desc: Whether the operation could not be completed by the last level data cache (or any above)

cols.name: remote_access
cols.desc: Operation caused an access to another socket in a multi-socket system

cols.name: alignment
cols.desc: Operation that incurred additional latency due to the alignment of the address and the size of the data being accessed

cols.name: tme_transaction
cols.desc: Whether the operation executed in transactional state

cols.name: sve_partial_pred
cols.desc: SVE or SME operation with at least one false element in the governing predicate(s)

cols.name: sve_empty_pred
cols.desc: SVE or SME operation with no true element in the governing predicate(s)

cols.name: l2d_access
cols.desc: Whether a load operation caused a cache access to at least the level 2 data or unified cache

cols.name: l2d_hit
cols.desc: Whether a load operation accessed and missed the level 2 data or unified cache. Not set for accesses that are satisfied from refilling data of a previous miss

cols.name: cache_data_modified
cols.desc: Whether a load operation accessed modified data in a cache

cols.name: recenty_fetched
cols.desc: Wheter a load operation hit a recently fetched line in a cache

cols.name: data_snooped
cols.desc: Whether a load operation snooped data from a cache outside the cache hierarchy of this core

modules.data_check_sql: SELECT EXISTS(SELECT 1 FROM __intrinsic_spe_record LIMIT 1) AS has_data

data_objects.name: memory_rss_and_swap_per_process
data_objects.desc: Memory metrics timeline for each process.
data_objects.summary_desc: Memory metrics timeline for each process

cols.name: ts
cols.desc: Timestamp

cols.name: dur
cols.desc: Duration

cols.name: upid
cols.desc: Upid of the process

cols.name: pid
cols.desc: Pid of the process

cols.name: process_name
cols.desc: Name of the process

cols.name: anon_rss
cols.desc: Anon RSS counter value

cols.name: file_rss
cols.desc: File RSS counter value

cols.name: shmem_rss
cols.desc: Shared memory RSS counter value

cols.name: rss
cols.desc: Total RSS value. Sum of `anon_rss`, `file_rss` and `shmem_rss`. Returns value even if one of the values is NULL.

cols.name: swap
cols.desc: Swap counter value

cols.name: anon_rss_and_swap
cols.desc: Sum or `anon_rss` and `swap`. Returns value even if one of the values is NULL.

cols.name: rss_and_swap
cols.desc: Sum or `rss` and `swap`. Returns value even if one of the values is NULL.

data_objects.desc:
For each process fetches the memory high watermark until or during

cols.name: ts
cols.desc: Timestamp

cols.name: dur
cols.desc: Duration

cols.name: upid
cols.desc: Upid of the process

cols.name: pid
cols.desc: Pid of the process

cols.name: process_name
cols.desc: Name of the process

cols.name: rss_high_watermark
cols.desc: Maximum `rss` value until now

data_objects.name: cpu_idle_stats
data_objects.desc: Aggregates cpu idle statistics per core.
data_objects.summary_desc: Aggregates cpu idle statistics per core

cols.name: cpu
cols.desc: CPU core number.

cols.name: state
cols.desc: CPU idle state (C-states).

cols.name: count
cols.desc: The count of entering idle state.

cols.name: dur
cols.desc: Total CPU core idle state duration.

cols.name: avg_dur
cols.desc: Average CPU core idle state duration.

cols.name: idle_percent
cols.desc: Idle state percentage of non suspend time (C-states + P-states).

data_objects.name: cpu_idle_counters
data_objects.desc:
Counter information for each idle state change for each CPU. Finds each time
 region where a CPU idle state is constant.
data_objects.summary_desc: Counter information for each idle state change for each CPU

cols.name: id
cols.desc: Counter id.

cols.name: track_id
cols.desc: Joinable with 'counter_track.id'.

cols.name: ts
cols.desc: Starting timestamp of the counter.

cols.name: dur
cols.desc: Duration in which the counter is contant and idle state doesn't change.

cols.name: idle
cols.desc: Idle state of the CPU that corresponds to this counter. An idle state of -1 is defined to be active state for the CPU, and the larger the integer, the deeper the idle state of the CPU. NULL if not found or undefined.

cols.name: cpu
cols.desc: CPU that corresponds to this counter.

data_objects.name: cpu_frequency_counters
data_objects.desc:
Counter information for each frequency change for each CPU. Finds each time
 region where a CPU frequency is constant.
data_objects.summary_desc: Counter information for each frequency change for each CPU

cols.name: id
cols.desc: Counter id.

cols.name: track_id
cols.desc: Joinable with 'counter_track.id'.

cols.name: ts
cols.desc: Starting timestamp of the counter

cols.name: dur
cols.desc: Duration in which counter is constant and frequency doesn't change.

cols.name: freq
cols.desc: Frequency in kHz of the CPU that corresponds to this counter. NULL if not found or undefined.

cols.name: ucpu
cols.desc: Unique CPU id.

cols.name: cpu
cols.desc: CPU that corresponds to this counter.

data_objects.name: linux_per_cpu_idle_time_in_state_counters
data_objects.desc:
Percentage counter information for sysfs cpuidle states.
 For each state per cpu, report the incremental time spent in one state,
 divided by time spent in all states, between two timestamps.
data_objects.summary_desc: Percentage counter information for sysfs cpuidle states

cols.name: ts
cols.desc: Timestamp.

cols.name: machine_id
cols.desc: The machine this residency is calculated for.

cols.name: state
cols.desc: State name.

cols.name: cpu
cols.desc: CPU.

cols.name: idle_percentage
cols.desc: Percentage of time this cpu spent in this state.

cols.name: total_residency
cols.desc: Incremental time spent in this state (residency), in microseconds.

cols.name: time_slice
cols.desc: Time this cpu spent in any state, in microseconds.

data_objects.name: linux_cpu_idle_time_in_state_counters
data_objects.desc:
Percentage counter information for sysfs cpuidle states.
 For each state across all CPUs, report the incremental time spent in one
 state, divided by time spent in all states, between two timestamps.
data_objects.summary_desc: Percentage counter information for sysfs cpuidle states

cols.name: ts
cols.desc: Timestamp.

cols.name: machine_id
cols.desc: The machine this residency is calculated for.

cols.name: state
cols.desc: State name.

cols.name: idle_percentage
cols.desc: Percentage of time all CPUS spent in this state.

cols.name: total_residency
cols.desc: Incremental time spent in this state (residency), in microseconds.

cols.name: time_slice
cols.desc: Time all CPUS spent in any state, in microseconds.

data_objects.name: cpu_utilization_per_second
data_objects.desc:
Table with system utilization per second.
 Utilization is calculated by sum of average utilization of each CPU every
 second. For this reason first and last second might have lower then real
 utilization.
data_objects.summary_desc: Table with system utilization per second

cols.name: ts
cols.desc: Timestamp of start of a second.

cols.name: utilization
cols.desc: Sum of average utilization over period. Note: as the data is normalized, the values will be in the [0, 1] range.

cols.name: unnormalized_utilization
cols.desc: Sum of average utilization over all CPUs over period. Note: as the data is unnormalized, the values will be in the [0, cpu_count] range.

data_objects.name: cpu_cycles
data_objects.desc: Aggregated CPU statistics for whole trace. Results in only one row.
data_objects.summary_desc: Aggregated CPU statistics for whole trace

cols.name: millicycles
cols.desc: Sum of CPU millicycles.

cols.name: megacycles
cols.desc: Sum of CPU megacycles.

cols.name: runtime
cols.desc: Total runtime of all threads running on all CPUs.

cols.name: min_freq
cols.desc: Minimum CPU frequency in kHz.

cols.name: max_freq
cols.desc: Maximum CPU frequency in kHz.

cols.name: avg_freq
cols.desc: Average CPU frequency in kHz.

data_objects.name: cpu_cycles_per_cpu
data_objects.desc: Aggregated CPU statistics for each CPU.
data_objects.summary_desc: Aggregated CPU statistics for each CPU

cols.name: ucpu
cols.desc: Unique CPU id. Joinable with `cpu.id`.

cols.name: cpu
cols.desc: The number of the CPU. Might not be the same as ucpu in multi machine cases.

cols.name: millicycles
cols.desc: Sum of CPU millicycles.

cols.name: megacycles
cols.desc: Sum of CPU megacycles.

cols.name: runtime
cols.desc: Total runtime of all threads running on CPU.

cols.name: min_freq
cols.desc: Minimum CPU frequency in kHz.

cols.name: max_freq
cols.desc: Maximum CPU frequency in kHz.

cols.name: avg_freq
cols.desc: Average CPU frequency in kHz.

table_functions.name: cpu_utilization_per_period
table_functions.desc:
Returns a table of system utilization per given period.
 Utilization is calculated as sum of average utilization of each CPU in each
 period, which is defined as a multiply of |interval|. For this reason
 first and last period might have lower then real utilization.
table_functions.summary_desc: Returns a table of system utilization per given period

args.name: interval
args.desc: Length of the period on which utilization should be averaged.

cols.name: ts
cols.desc: Timestamp of start of a second.

cols.name: utilization
cols.desc: Sum of average utilization over period. Note: as the data is normalized, the values will be in the [0, 1] range.

cols.name: unnormalized_utilization
cols.desc: Sum of average utilization over all CPUs over period. Note: as the data is unnormalized, the values will be in the [0, cpu_count] range.

table_functions.name: cpu_cycles_in_interval
table_functions.desc:
Aggregated CPU statistics in a provided interval. Results in one row.

 This function is only designed to run over a small number of intervals
 (10-100 at most). It will be *very slow* for large sets of intervals.
table_functions.summary_desc: Aggregated CPU statistics in a provided interval

cols.name: millicycles
cols.desc: Sum of CPU millicycles.

cols.name: megacycles
cols.desc: Sum of CPU megacycles.

cols.name: runtime
cols.desc: Total runtime of all threads running on all CPUs.

cols.name: awake_runtime
cols.desc: Total runtime of all threads running on all CPUs, while 'awake' (CPUs not suspended).

cols.name: min_freq
cols.desc: Minimum CPU frequency in kHz.

cols.name: max_freq
cols.desc: Maximum CPU frequency in kHz.

cols.name: avg_freq
cols.desc: Average CPU frequency in kHz.

table_functions.name: cpu_utilization_in_interval
table_functions.desc:
Returns a table of CPU utilization over a given interval.

 Utilization  is computed as runtime over the duration of the interval.
 Utilization can be normalized (divide by number of cores) or unnormalized.

 This function is only designed to run over a small number of intervals
 (10-100 at most). It will be *very slow* for large sets of intervals.
table_functions.summary_desc: Returns a table of CPU utilization over a given interval

cols.name: awake_dur
cols.desc: Total runtime of all threads running on all CPUs, while 'awake' (CPUs not suspended).

cols.name: awake_utilization
cols.desc: Percentage of 'awake_dur' over the 'awake' duration of the interval, normalized by the number of CPUs. Values in [0.0, 100.0]

cols.name: awake_unnormalized_utilization
cols.desc: Percentage of 'awake_dur' over the 'awake' duration of the interval, unnormalized. Values in [0.0, 100.0 * <number_of_cpus>]

table_functions.name: cpu_cycles_per_cpu_in_interval
table_functions.desc:
Aggregated CPU statistics for each CPU in a provided interval.

 This function is only designed to run over a small number of intervals
 (10-100 at most). It will be *very slow* for large sets of intervals.
table_functions.summary_desc: Aggregated CPU statistics for each CPU in a provided interval

cols.name: ucpu
cols.desc: Unique CPU id. Joinable with `cpu.id`.

cols.name: cpu
cols.desc: CPU number.

cols.name: millicycles
cols.desc: Sum of CPU millicycles.

cols.name: megacycles
cols.desc: Sum of CPU megacycles.

cols.name: runtime
cols.desc: Total runtime of all threads running on CPU.

cols.name: min_freq
cols.desc: Minimum CPU frequency in kHz.

cols.name: max_freq
cols.desc: Maximum CPU frequency in kHz.

cols.name: avg_freq
cols.desc: Average CPU frequency in kHz.

table_functions.name: cpu_thread_utilization_in_interval
table_functions.desc:
Returns a table of thread utilization over a given interval.

 Utilization is computed as runtime over the duration of the interval, aggregated by UTID.

Aggregated CPU statistics for each process in a provided interval.

 This function is only designed to run over a small number of intervals
 (10-100 at most). It will be *very slow* for large sets of intervals.

cols.desc: Maximum CPU frequency in kHz

table_functions.name: cpu_process_utilization_in_interval
table_functions.desc:
Returns a table with process utilization over a given interval.

 Utilization is computed as runtime over the duration of the interval, aggregated by UPID.
 Utilization can be normalized (divide by number of cpus) or unnormalized.

 This function is only designed to run over a small number of intervals
 (10-100 at most). It will be *very slow* for large sets of intervals.
table_functions.summary_desc: Returns a table with process utilization over a given interval

cols.name: upid
cols.desc: Unique process id.

cols.name: process_name
cols.desc: The name of the process.

cols.name: awake_dur
cols.desc: Total runtime of all processes with this UPID, while 'awake' (CPUs not suspended).

cols.name: awake_utilization
cols.desc: Percentage of 'awake_dur' over the 'awake' duration of the interval, normalized by the number of CPUs. Values in [0.0, 100.0]

cols.name: awake_unnormalized_utilization
cols.desc: Percentage of 'awake_dur' over the 'awake' duration of the interval, unnormalized. Values in [0.0, 100.0 * <number_of_cpus>]

macros.name: counter_leading_intervals
macros.desc:
For a given counter timeline (e.g. a single counter track), returns
 intervals of time where the counter has the same value. For every run
 of identical values, this macro will return a row for the first one,
 the last one, and a row merging all other ones. This to to facilitate
 construction of counters from delta_values.

 Intervals are computed in a "forward-looking" way. That is, if a counter
 changes value at some timestamp, it's assumed it *just* reached that
 value and it should continue to have that value until the next
 value change. The final value is assumed to hold until the very end of
 the trace.

 For example, suppose we have the following data:
 ```
 ts=0, value=10, track_id=1
 ts=0, value=10, track_id=2
 ts=10, value=10, track_id=1
 ts=10, value=20, track_id=2
 ts=20, value=30, track_id=1
 [end of trace at ts = 40]
 ```

 Then this macro will generate the following intervals:
 ```
 ts=0, dur=10, value=10, track_id=1
 ts=10, dur=10, value=10, track_id=1
 ts=20, dur=10, value=30, track_id=1
 ts=0, dur=10, value=10, track_id=2
 ts=10, dur=30, value=20, track_id=2
 ```
macros.summary_desc: For a given counter timeline (e.g
macros.return_desc: Table with the schema: id LONG, As passed in ts TIMESTAMP, As passed in dur DURATION, Difference to the timestamp for the leading row. track_id JOINID(track.id), As passed in value DOUBLE, As passed in next_value DOUBLE, Value for the leading row. delta_value DOUBLE Delta to the *lagging* row - note that this is not the same thing as (next_value - value).

args.name: counter_table
args.desc: A table/view/subquery corresponding to a "counter-like" table. This table must have the columns "id" and "ts" and "track_id" and "value" corresponding to an id, timestamp, counter track_id and associated counter value.

macros.name: wattson_threads_aggregation
macros.desc:
========================================================
 MACRO: wattson_threads_aggregation

 Calculates energy and power attribution per thread/process for the
 given time windows.

 Input:
   window_table: A table with columns (ts, dur, period_id).

 Output:
   Flat table with columns:
     period_id, period_dur, utid, tid, pid,
     thread_name, process_name,
     estimated_mws, estimated_mw, idle_transitions_mws, total_mws
 ========================================================
macros.summary_desc: ========================================================  MACRO: wattson_threads_aggregation   Calculates energy and power attribution per thread/process for the  given time windows

args.name: window_table
args.desc: Intereseted window table with columns: (ts, dur, period_id).

========================================================
 MACRO: wattson_rails_aggregation

 Flattening and unpivoting of rail data into a standard breakdown.

 Input:
   window_table: A table with columns (ts, dur, period_id).

 Output:
   Flat breakdown including CORE, POLICY, DSU and SUBSYSTEM TOTAL.
 ========================================================
macros.summary_desc: ========================================================  MACRO: wattson_rails_aggregation   Flattening and unpivoting of rail data into a standard breakdown

data_objects.name: cpu_profiling_samples
data_objects.desc:
Table containing all the timestamped samples of CPU profiling which occurred
 during the trace.

 Currently, this table is backed by the following data sources:
  * Linux perf
  * Simpleperf proto format
  * macOS instruments
  * Chrome CPU profiling
  * Legacy V8 CPU profiling
  * Profiling data in Gecko traces
data_objects.summary_desc: Table containing all the timestamped samples of CPU profiling which occurred  during the trace

cols.name: id
cols.desc: The id of the sample.

cols.name: ts
cols.desc: The timestamp of the sample.

cols.name: utid
cols.desc: The utid of the thread of the sample, if available.

cols.name: tid
cols.desc: The tid of the sample, if available.

cols.name: thread_name
cols.desc: The thread name of thread of the sample, if available.

cols.name: ucpu
cols.desc: The ucpu of the sample, if available.

cols.name: cpu
cols.desc: The cpu of the sample, if available.

cols.name: callsite_id
cols.desc: The callsite id of the sample.

data_objects.name: cpu_profiling_summary_tree
data_objects.desc:
Table summarising the callstacks captured during any CPU profiling which
 occurred during the trace.

 Specifically, this table returns a tree containing all the callstacks seen
 during the trace with `self_count` equal to the number of samples with that
 frame as the leaf and `cumulative_count` equal to the number of samples with
 the frame anywhere in the tree.

 The data sources supported are the same as the `cpu_profiling_samples` table.
data_objects.summary_desc: Table summarising the callstacks captured during any CPU profiling which  occurred during the trace

cols.name: id
cols.desc: The id of the callstack; by callstack we mean a unique set of frames up to the root frame.

cols.name: parent_id
cols.desc: The id of the parent callstack for this callstack. NULL if this is root.

cols.name: name
cols.desc: The function name of the frame for this callstack.

cols.name: mapping_name
cols.desc: The name of the mapping containing the frame. This can be a native binary, library, JAR or APK.

cols.name: source_file
cols.desc: The name of the file containing the function.

cols.name: line_number
cols.desc: The line number in the file the function is located at.

cols.name: self_count
cols.desc: The number of samples with this function as the leaf frame.

cols.name: cumulative_count
cols.desc: The number of samples with this function appearing anywhere on the callstack.

data_objects.name: chrome_scrolls
data_objects.desc:
Defines slices for all of the individual scrolls in a trace based on the
 LatencyInfo-based scroll definition.

 NOTE: this view of top level scrolls is based on the LatencyInfo definition
 of a scroll, which differs subtly from the definition based on
 EventLatencies.
 TODO(b/278684408): add support for tracking scrolls across multiple Chrome/
 WebView instances. Currently gesture_scroll_id unique within an instance, but
 is not unique across multiple instances. Switching to an EventLatency based
 definition of scrolls should resolve this.
data_objects.summary_desc: Defines slices for all of the individual scrolls in a trace based on the  LatencyInfo-based scroll definition

cols.name: id
cols.desc: The unique identifier of the scroll.

cols.name: ts
cols.desc: The start timestamp of the scroll.

cols.name: dur
cols.desc: The duration of the scroll.

cols.name: gesture_scroll_begin_ts
cols.desc: The earliest timestamp of the EventLatency slice of the GESTURE_SCROLL_BEGIN type for the corresponding scroll id.

cols.name: gesture_scroll_end_ts
cols.desc: The earliest timestamp of the EventLatency slice of the GESTURE_SCROLL_END type / the latest timestamp of the EventLatency slice of the GESTURE_SCROLL_UPDATE type for the corresponding scroll id.

data_objects.name: chrome_scroll_update_info
data_objects.desc:
Timestamps and durations for the critical path stages during scrolling.
 This table covers both the input-associated (before coalescing inputs into a
 frame) and frame-associated (after coalescing inputs into a frame) stages of
 a scroll:

                              ...
                               |
                +--------------+--------------+
                |                             |
                V                             V
   +-------------------------+   +-------------------------+
   | _scroll_update_INPUT_   |   | _scroll_update_FRAME_   |
   | timestamps_and_metadata |   | timestamps_and_metadata |
   +------------+------------+   +------------+------------+
                |                             |
                V                             V
    +-----------------------+     +-----------------------+
    | chrome_scroll_update_ |     | chrome_scroll_update_ |
    |     INPUT_pipeline    |     |     FRAME_pipeline    |
    +-----------+-----------+     +-----------+-----------+
                |                             |
                +--------------+--------------+
                               |
                               V
                 +---------------------------+
                 | chrome_scroll_update_info |
                 +---------------------------+
data_objects.summary_desc: Timestamps and durations for the critical path stages during scrolling

cols.name: id
cols.desc: Id of the `LatencyInfo.Flow` slices corresponding to this scroll event.

cols.name: scroll_id
cols.desc: Id of the scroll this scroll update belongs to.

cols.name: previous_input_id
cols.desc: Id (`LatencyInfo.ID`) of the previous input in this scroll.

cols.name: frame_display_id
cols.desc: Id (`display_trace_id`) of the aggregated frame which this scroll update was presented in.

cols.name: vsync_interval_ms
cols.desc: Vsync interval (in milliseconds).

cols.name: is_presented
cols.desc: Whether this input event was presented.

cols.name: is_janky
cols.desc: Whether the corresponding frame is janky based on the Event.ScrollJank.DelayedFramesPercentage.FixedWindow metric. This comes directly from `perfetto.protos.EventLatency.is_janky_scrolled_frame`.

cols.name: is_inertial
cols.desc: Whether the corresponding scroll is inertial (fling). If this is `true`, "generation" and "touch_move" related timestamps and durations will be null.

cols.name: is_first_scroll_update_in_scroll
cols.desc: Whether this is the first update in a scroll. First scroll update can never be janky.

cols.name: is_first_scroll_update_in_frame
cols.desc: Whether this is the first input that was presented in the frame.

cols.name: browser_uptime_dur
cols.desc: Duration from the start of the browser process to the first input generation timestamp.

cols.name: generation_ts
cols.desc: Input generation timestamp (from the Android system).

cols.name: input_reader_dur
cols.desc: Duration from the generation timestamp to the end of InputReader's work. Only populated when atrace 'input' category is enabled.

cols.name: input_dispatcher_dur
cols.desc: Duration of InputDispatcher's work. Only populated when atrace 'input' category is enabled.

cols.name: since_previous_generation_dur
cols.desc: Duration from the generation timestamp for the previous input to this input's generation timestamp.

cols.name: generation_to_browser_main_dur
cols.desc: Duration from input generation to when the browser received the input.

cols.name: browser_utid
cols.desc: Utid for the browser main thread.

cols.name: touch_move_received_slice_id
cols.desc: Slice id for the `STEP_SEND_INPUT_EVENT_UI` slice for the touch move.

cols.name: touch_move_received_ts
cols.desc: Timestamp for the `STEP_SEND_INPUT_EVENT_UI` slice for the touch move.

cols.name: touch_move_processing_dur
cols.desc: Duration for processing  a `TouchMove` event.

cols.name: scroll_update_created_slice_id
cols.desc: Slice id for the `STEP_SEND_INPUT_EVENT_UI` slice for the gesture scroll.

cols.name: scroll_update_created_ts
cols.desc: Timestamp for the `STEP_SEND_INPUT_EVENT_UI` slice for the gesture scroll.

cols.name: scroll_update_processing_dur
cols.desc: Duration for creating a `GestureScrollUpdate` from a `TouchMove` event.

cols.name: scroll_update_created_end_ts
cols.desc: End timestamp for the `STEP_SEND_INPUT_EVENT_UI` slice for the above.

cols.name: browser_to_compositor_delay_dur
cols.desc: Duration between the browser and compositor dispatch.

cols.name: compositor_utid
cols.desc: Utid for the renderer compositor thread.

cols.name: compositor_dispatch_slice_id
cols.desc: Slice id for the `STEP_HANDLE_INPUT_EVENT_IMPL` slice.

cols.name: compositor_dispatch_ts
cols.desc: Timestamp for the `STEP_HANDLE_INPUT_EVENT_IMPL` slice or the containing task (if available).

cols.name: compositor_dispatch_dur
cols.desc: Duration for the compositor dispatch itself.

cols.name: compositor_dispatch_end_ts
cols.desc: End timestamp for the `STEP_HANDLE_INPUT_EVENT_IMPL` slice.

cols.name: compositor_dispatch_to_on_begin_frame_delay_dur
cols.desc: Duration between compositor dispatch and input resampling work.

cols.name: compositor_resample_slice_id
cols.desc: Slice id for the `STEP_RESAMPLE_SCROLL_EVENTS` slice.

cols.name: compositor_coalesced_input_handled_slice_id
cols.desc: Slice id for the `STEP_DID_HANDLE_INPUT_AND_OVERSCROLL` slice.

cols.name: compositor_on_begin_frame_ts
cols.desc: Start timestamp for work done on the input during "OnBeginFrame".

cols.name: compositor_on_begin_frame_dur
cols.desc: Duration of the "OnBeginFrame" work for this input.

cols.name: compositor_on_begin_frame_end_ts
cols.desc: End timestamp for work done on the input during "OnBeginFrame".

cols.name: compositor_on_begin_frame_to_generation_delay_dur
cols.desc: Delay until the compositor work for generating the frame begins.

cols.name: compositor_generate_compositor_frame_slice_id
cols.desc: Slice id for the `STEP_GENERATE_COMPOSITOR_FRAME` slice.

cols.name: compositor_generate_compositor_frame_ts
cols.desc: Timestamp for the `STEP_GENERATE_COMPOSITOR_FRAME` slice or the containing task (if available).

cols.name: compositor_generate_frame_to_submit_frame_dur
cols.desc: Duration between generating and submitting the compositor frame.

cols.name: compositor_submit_compositor_frame_slice_id
cols.desc: Slice id for the `STEP_SUBMIT_COMPOSITOR_FRAME` slice.

cols.name: compositor_submit_compositor_frame_ts
cols.desc: Timestamp for the `STEP_SUBMIT_COMPOSITOR_FRAME` slice.

cols.name: compositor_submit_frame_dur
cols.desc: Duration for submitting the compositor frame (to viz).

cols.name: compositor_submit_compositor_frame_end_ts
cols.desc: End timestamp for the `STEP_SUBMIT_COMPOSITOR_FRAME` slice.

cols.name: compositor_to_viz_delay_dur
cols.desc: Delay when a compositor frame is sent from the renderer to viz.

cols.name: viz_compositor_utid
cols.desc: Utid for the viz compositor thread.

cols.name: viz_receive_compositor_frame_slice_id
cols.desc: Slice id for the `STEP_RECEIVE_COMPOSITOR_FRAME` slice.

cols.name: viz_receive_compositor_frame_ts
cols.desc: Timestamp for the `STEP_RECEIVE_COMPOSITOR_FRAME` slice or the containing task (if available).

cols.name: viz_receive_compositor_frame_dur
cols.desc: Duration of the viz work done on receiving the compositor frame.

cols.name: viz_receive_compositor_frame_end_ts
cols.desc: End timestamp for the `STEP_RECEIVE_COMPOSITOR_FRAME` slice.

cols.name: viz_wait_for_draw_dur
cols.desc: Duration between viz receiving the compositor frame to frame draw.

cols.name: viz_draw_and_swap_slice_id
cols.desc: Slice id for the `STEP_DRAW_AND_SWAP` slice.

cols.name: viz_draw_and_swap_ts
cols.desc: Timestamp for the `STEP_DRAW_AND_SWAP` slice or the containing task (if available).

cols.name: viz_draw_and_swap_dur
cols.desc: Duration for the viz drawing/swapping work for this frame.

cols.name: viz_send_buffer_swap_slice_id
cols.desc: Slice id for the `STEP_SEND_BUFFER_SWAP` slice.

cols.name: viz_send_buffer_swap_end_ts
cols.desc: End timestamp for the `STEP_SEND_BUFFER_SWAP` slice.

cols.name: viz_to_gpu_delay_dur
cols.desc: Delay between viz work on compositor thread and `CompositorGpuThread`.

cols.name: viz_gpu_thread_utid
cols.desc: Utid for the viz `CompositorGpuThread`.

cols.name: viz_swap_buffers_slice_id
cols.desc: Slice id for the `STEP_BUFFER_SWAP_POST_SUBMIT` slice.

cols.name: viz_swap_buffers_ts
cols.desc: Timestamp for the `STEP_BUFFER_SWAP_POST_SUBMIT` slice or the containing task (if available).

cols.name: viz_swap_buffers_dur
cols.desc: Duration of frame buffer swapping work on viz.

cols.name: viz_swap_buffers_end_ts
cols.desc: End timestamp for the `STEP_BUFFER_SWAP_POST_SUBMIT` slice.

cols.name: viz_swap_buffers_to_latch_dur
cols.desc: Duration of `EventLatency`'s `BufferReadyToLatch` step.

cols.name: latch_timestamp
cols.desc: Timestamp for `EventLatency`'s `LatchToSwapEnd` step.

cols.name: viz_latch_to_presentation_dur
cols.desc: Duration of either `EventLatency`'s `LatchToSwapEnd` + `SwapEndToPresentationCompositorFrame` steps or its `LatchToPresentation` step.

cols.name: presentation_timestamp
cols.desc: Presentation timestamp for the frame.

data_objects.name: chrome_scroll_frame_info
data_objects.desc:
A list of all presented Chrome frames which contain scroll updates and associated
 metadata.
data_objects.summary_desc: A list of all presented Chrome frames which contain scroll updates and associated  metadata

cols.name: id
cols.desc: Id (frame's display_trace_id) for the given frame.

cols.name: scroll_id
cols.desc: Id of the scroll this scroll update belongs to.

cols.name: last_input_before_this_frame_id
cols.desc: Id (LatencyInfo.ID) of the last input before this frame.

cols.name: vsync_interval_ms
cols.desc: Vsync interval (in milliseconds). TODO(b/394303662): Remove in favour of `vsync_interval_dur`.

cols.name: vsync_interval_dur
cols.desc: Vsync interval (in nanoseconds).

cols.name: is_janky
cols.desc: Whether the corresponding frame is janky based on the Event.ScrollJank.DelayedFramesPercentage.FixedWindow metric. This comes directly from `perfetto.protos.EventLatency.is_janky_scrolled_frame`.

cols.name: is_inertial
cols.desc: Whether the corresponding scroll is inertial (fling).

cols.name: total_input_delta_y
cols.desc: Sum of all input deltas for all scroll updates in this frame. These values are based on the delta of the OS input events.

cols.name: presented_scrolled_delta_y
cols.desc: Presented delta (change in page offset) for the given frame. This delta is computed by Chrome (based on the input events).

cols.name: browser_uptime_dur
cols.desc: Duration from the start of the browser process to the first input generation timestamp.

cols.name: first_input_generation_ts
cols.desc: Input generation timestamp (from the Android system) for the first input.

cols.name: input_reader_dur
cols.desc: Duration from the generation timestamp to the end of InputReader's work. Only populated when atrace 'input' category is enabled.

cols.name: input_dispatcher_dur
cols.desc: Duration of InputDispatcher's work. Only populated when atrace 'input' category is enabled.

cols.name: previous_last_input_to_first_input_generation_dur
cols.desc: Duration from the previous input (last input that wasn't part of this frame) to the first input in this frame.

cols.name: presentation_ts
cols.desc: Presentation timestamp for the frame.

cols.name: browser_utid
cols.desc: Utid for the browser main thread.

cols.name: first_input_generation_to_browser_main_dur
cols.desc: Duration from input generation to when the browser received the first input in this frame.

cols.name: first_input_generation_to_browser_main_delta_dur
cols.desc: Difference between `first_input_generation_to_browser_main_dur` for this frame and the previous frame in the same scroll.

cols.name: first_input_touch_move_processing_dur
cols.desc: Duration for processing  a `TouchMove` event for the first input in this frame.

cols.name: first_input_touch_move_processing_delta_dur
cols.desc: Difference between `first_input_touch_move_processing_dur` for this frame and the previous frame in the same scroll.

cols.name: compositor_utid
cols.desc: Utid for the renderer compositor thread.

cols.name: first_input_browser_to_compositor_delay_dur
cols.desc: Duration between the browser and compositor dispatch for the first input in this frame.

cols.name: first_input_browser_to_compositor_delay_delta_dur
cols.desc: Difference between `first_input_browser_to_compositor_delay_dur` for this frame and the previous frame in the same scroll.

cols.name: first_input_compositor_dispatch_dur
cols.desc: Duration for the compositor dispatch for the first input in this frame.

cols.name: first_input_compositor_dispatch_delta_dur
cols.desc: Difference between `first_input_compositor_dispatch_dur` for this frame and the previous frame in the same scroll.

cols.name: first_input_compositor_dispatch_to_on_begin_frame_delay_dur
cols.desc: Duration between the compositor dispatch and the "OnBeginFrame" work for the first input in this frame.

cols.name: first_input_compositor_dispatch_to_on_begin_frame_delay_delta_dur
cols.desc: Difference between `first_input_compositor_dispatch_to_on_begin_frame_delay_dur` for this frame and the previous frame in the same scroll.

cols.name: compositor_on_begin_frame_dur
cols.desc: Duration of the "OnBeginFrame" work for this frame.

cols.name: compositor_on_begin_frame_delta_dur
cols.desc: Difference between `compositor_on_begin_frame_dur` for this frame and the previous frame in the same scroll.

cols.name: compositor_on_begin_frame_to_generation_delay_dur
cols.desc: Duration between the "OnBeginFrame" work and the generation of this frame.

cols.name: compositor_on_begin_frame_to_generation_delay_delta_dur
cols.desc: Difference between `compositor_on_begin_frame_to_generation_delay_dur` for this frame and the previous frame in the same scroll.

cols.name: compositor_generate_frame_to_submit_frame_dur
cols.desc: Duration between the generation and submission of this frame.

cols.name: compositor_generate_frame_to_submit_frame_delta_dur
cols.desc: Difference between `compositor_generate_frame_to_submit_frame_dur` for this frame and the previous frame in the same scroll.

cols.name: compositor_submit_frame_dur
cols.desc: Duration for submitting this frame.

cols.name: compositor_submit_frame_delta_dur
cols.desc: Difference between `compositor_submit_frame_dur` for this frame and the previous frame in the same scroll.

cols.name: viz_compositor_utid
cols.desc: Utid for the viz compositor thread.

cols.name: compositor_to_viz_delay_dur
cols.desc: Delay when a compositor frame is sent from the renderer to viz.

cols.name: compositor_to_viz_delay_delta_dur
cols.desc: Difference between `compositor_to_viz_delay_dur` for this frame and the previous frame in the same scroll.

cols.name: viz_receive_compositor_frame_dur
cols.desc: Duration of the viz work done on receiving the compositor frame.

cols.name: viz_receive_compositor_frame_delta_dur
cols.desc: Difference between `viz_receive_compositor_frame_dur` for this frame and the previous frame in the same scroll.

cols.name: viz_wait_for_draw_dur
cols.desc: Duration between viz receiving the compositor frame to frame draw.

cols.name: viz_wait_for_draw_delta_dur
cols.desc: Difference between `viz_wait_for_draw_dur` for this frame and the previous frame in the same scroll.

cols.name: viz_draw_and_swap_dur
cols.desc: Duration of the viz drawing/swapping work for this frame.

cols.name: viz_draw_and_swap_delta_dur
cols.desc: Difference between `viz_draw_and_swap_dur` for this frame and the previous frame in the same scroll.

cols.name: viz_gpu_thread_utid
cols.desc: Utid for the viz `CompositorGpuThread`.

cols.name: viz_to_gpu_delay_dur
cols.desc: Delay between viz work on compositor thread and `CompositorGpuThread`.

cols.name: viz_to_gpu_delay_delta_dur
cols.desc: Difference between `viz_to_gpu_delay_dur` for this frame and the previous frame in the same scroll.

cols.name: viz_swap_buffers_dur
cols.desc: Duration of frame buffer swapping work on viz.

cols.name: viz_swap_buffers_delta_dur
cols.desc: Difference between `viz_swap_buffers_dur` for this frame and the previous frame in the same scroll.

cols.name: viz_swap_buffers_to_latch_dur
cols.desc: Time between buffers ready until Choreographer's latch.

cols.name: viz_swap_buffers_to_latch_delta_dur
cols.desc: Difference between `viz_swap_buffers_to_latch_dur` for this frame and the previous frame in the same scroll.

cols.name: viz_latch_to_presentation_dur
cols.desc: Duration between Choreographer's latch and presentation.

cols.name: viz_latch_to_presentation_delta_dur
cols.desc: Difference between `viz_latch_to_presentation_dur` for this frame and the previous frame in the same scroll.

data_objects.name: chrome_scroll_update_info_step_templates
data_objects.desc:
Source of truth for the definition of the stages of a scroll. Mainly intended
 for visualization purposes (e.g. in Chrome Scroll Jank plugin).
data_objects.summary_desc: Source of truth for the definition of the stages of a scroll

cols.name: step_name
cols.desc: The name of a stage of a scroll.

cols.name: ts_column_name
cols.desc: The name of the column in `chrome_scroll_update_info` which contains the timestamp of the stage.

cols.name: dur_column_name
cols.desc: The name of the column in `chrome_scroll_update_info` which contains the duration of the stage. NULL if the stage doesn't have a duration.

data_objects.name: chrome_histograms
data_objects.desc:
A helper view on top of the histogram events emitted by Chrome.
 Requires "disabled-by-default-histogram_samples" Chrome category or the
 "org.chromium.histogram_sample" data source.
data_objects.summary_desc: A helper view on top of the histogram events emitted by Chrome

cols.name: name
cols.desc: The name of the histogram.

cols.name: value
cols.desc: The value of the histogram sample.

cols.name: ts
cols.desc: Alias of |slice.ts|.

cols.name: thread_name
cols.desc: Thread name.

cols.name: utid
cols.desc: Utid of the thread.

cols.name: tid
cols.desc: Tid of the thread.

cols.name: process_name
cols.desc: Process name.

cols.name: upid
cols.desc: Upid of the process.

cols.name: pid
cols.desc: Pid of the process.

data_objects.name: chrome_scroll_jank_v4_results
data_objects.desc:
Results of the Scroll Jank V4 metric for frames which contain one or more
 scroll updates.

 See
 https://docs.google.com/document/d/1AaBvTIf8i-c-WTKkjaL4vyhQMkSdynxo3XEiwpofdeA
 and `EventLatency.ScrollJankV4Result` in
 https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/main:base/tracing/protos/chrome_track_event.proto
 for more information.

 Available since Chrome 145.0.7573.0 and cherry-picked into 144.0.7559.31.
data_objects.summary_desc: Results of the Scroll Jank V4 metric for frames which contain one or more  scroll updates

cols.name: id
cols.desc: Slice ID of the 'ScrollJankV4' slice.

cols.name: name
cols.desc: Slice name ('ScrollJankV4').

cols.name: ts
cols.desc: The timestamp at the start of the slice.

cols.name: dur
cols.desc: The duration of the slice.

cols.name: is_janky
cols.desc: Whether this frame is janky. True if and only if there's at least one row with `id` in `chrome_scroll_jank_v4_reasons`. If true, then `vsyncs_since_previous_frame` must be greater than one.

cols.name: vsyncs_since_previous_frame
cols.desc: How many VSyncs were between (A) this frame and (B) the previous frame. If this value is greater than one, then Chrome potentially missed one or more VSyncs (i.e. might have been able to present this scroll update earlier). NULL if this frame is the first frame in a scroll.

cols.name: running_delivery_cutoff
cols.desc: The running delivery cut-off based on frames preceding this frame. NULL if ANY of the following holds:  * This frame is the first frame in a scroll. * All frames since the beginning of the scroll up to and including the previous frame have been non-damaging. * The most recent janky frame was non-damaging and all frames since then up to and including the previous frame have been non-damaging.

cols.name: adjusted_delivery_cutoff
cols.desc: The running delivery cut-off adjusted for this frame. NULL if ANY of the following holds:  * This frame is the first frame in a scroll. * This frame is non-damaging. * All frames since the beginning of the scroll up to and including the previous frame have been non-damaging. * The most recent janky frame was non-damaging and all frames since then up to and including the previous frame have been non-damaging. * `vsyncs_since_previous_frame` is equal to one.

cols.name: current_delivery_cutoff
cols.desc: The delivery cut-off of this frame. NULL if this frame is non-damaging.

cols.name: real_first_event_latency_id
cols.desc: Trace ID of the first real scroll update included in this frame. Can be joined with `chrome_event_latencies.scroll_update_id`. NULL if this frame contains no real scroll updates.

cols.name: real_first_input_generation_ts
cols.desc: The actual generation timestamp of the first real scroll update included (coalesced) in this frame. NULL if this frame contains no real scroll updates.

cols.name: real_last_input_generation_ts
cols.desc: The actual generation timestamp of the last real scroll update included (coalesced) in this frame. NULL if this frame contains no real scroll updates.

cols.name: real_abs_total_raw_delta_pixels
cols.desc: The absolute total raw (unpredicted) delta of all real scroll updates included in this frame (in pixels). NULL if this frame contains no real scroll updates.

cols.name: real_max_abs_inertial_raw_delta_pixels
cols.desc: The maximum absolute raw (unpredicted) delta out of all inertial (fling) scroll updates included in this frame (in pixels). NULL if there were no inertial scroll updates in this frame.

cols.name: synthetic_first_event_latency_id
cols.desc: Trace ID of the first synthetic scroll update included in this frame. Can be joined with `chrome_event_latencies.scroll_update_id`. NULL if this frame contains no synthetic scroll updates.

cols.name: synthetic_first_extrapolated_input_generation_ts
cols.desc: The generation timestamp of the first synthetic scroll update included (coalesced) in this frame extrapolated based on the input generation → begin frame duration of the most recent real scroll update. NULL if ANY of the following holds:  * This frame contains no synthetic scroll updates. * This frame is janky (i.e. `is_janky` is true). * All frames since the beginning of the scroll up to and including the previous frame have contained only synthetic scroll updates. * The most recent janky frame contained only synthetic scroll updates and all frames since then up to and including the previous frame have contained only synthetic scroll updates.

cols.name: synthetic_first_original_begin_frame_ts
cols.desc: The begin frame timestamp of the first synthetic scroll update included (coalesced) in this frame. NULL if this frame contains no synthetic scroll updates. If not NULL, it's less than or equal to `begin_frame_ts`.

cols.name: first_scroll_update_type
cols.desc: Type of the first scroll update in this frame. Possible values:  * 'REAL' * 'SYNTHETIC_WITH_EXTRAPOLATED_INPUT_GENERATION_TIMESTAMP' * 'SYNTHETIC_WITHOUT_EXTRAPOLATED_INPUT_GENERATION_TIMESTAMP'  The first scroll update is decided as follows:  * For real scroll updates, we consider their actual input generation timestamp. * For synthetic scroll updates, we extrapolate their input generation timestamp based on the input generation → begin frame duration of the most recent real scroll update UNLESS ANY of the following holds (in which case we DON'T extrapolate input generation timestamps for synthetic scroll updates in this frame): * This frame is janky. * All frames since the beginning of the scroll up to and including the previous frame have contained only synthetic scroll updates. * The most recent janky frame contained only synthetic scroll updates and all frames since then up to and including the previous frame have contained only synthetic scroll updates.  If, based on the above rules, the scroll update with the earliest input generation timestamp is a real scroll update, then this frame's type is 'REAL'. If the scroll update with the earliest input generation timestamp is a synthetic scroll update, then this frame's type is 'SYNTHETIC_WITH_EXTRAPOLATED_INPUT_GENERATION_TIMESTAMP'.  If this frame contains only synthetic scroll updates but it wasn't possible to extrapolate their input generation timestamp (for any of the reasons listed above), then this frame's type is 'SYNTHETIC_WITHOUT_EXTRAPOLATED_INPUT_GENERATION_TIMESTAMP'.

cols.name: first_event_latency_id
cols.desc: Trace ID of the first scroll update included in this frame.  * If `first_scroll_update_type` is 'REAL', then `first_event_latency_id` is equal to `real_first_event_latency_id`. * If `first_scroll_update_type` is 'SYNTHETIC_WITH_EXTRAPOLATED_INPUT_GENERATION_TIMESTAMP' or 'SYNTHETIC_WITHOUT_EXTRAPOLATED_INPUT_GENERATION_TIMESTAMP', then `first_event_latency_id` equal to `synthetic_first_event_latency_id`.  Can be joined with `chrome_event_latencies.scroll_update_id`.

cols.name: damage_type
cols.desc: Type of scroll damage in this frame. Possible values:  * 'DAMAGING' * 'NON_DAMAGING_WITH_EXTRAPOLATED_PRESENTATION_TIMESTAMP' * 'NON_DAMAGING_WITHOUT_EXTRAPOLATED_PRESENTATION_TIMESTAMP'  A frame F is non-damaging if the following conditions are BOTH true:  1. All scroll updates in F are non-damaging. A scroll update is non-damaging if it didn't cause a frame update and/or didn't change the scroll offset.  2. All frames between (both ends exclusive): a. the last frame presented by Chrome before F and b. F are non-damaging.  If this frame is damaging, its type is 'DAMAGING'. If this frame is non-damaging and its presentation timestamp could be extrapolated based on the begin frame → presentation duration of the most recent damaging frame, its type is 'NON_DAMAGING_WITH_EXTRAPOLATED_PRESENTATION_TIMESTAMP'.  If this frame is non-damaging and its presentation timestamp couldn't be extrapolated for ANY of the reasons below, its type is 'NON_DAMAGING_WITHOUT_EXTRAPOLATED_PRESENTATION_TIMESTAMP':  * This frame is janky and non-damaging. * All frames since the beginning of the scroll up to and including this frame have been non-damaging. * The most recent janky frame was non-damaging and all frames since then up to and including the this frame have been non-damaging.  Note: The `first_scroll_update_type` and `damage_type` columns are orthogonal. The former depends on whether the frame is synthetic (only contains synthetic scroll updates). The latter depends on whether the frame is damaging. For example:  * If a frame is synthetic and damaging, it will[1] have an extrapolated input generation timestamp. * If a frame is real and non-damaging, it will[1] have an extrapolated presentation timestamp. * If a frame is both synthetic and damaging, it will[1] have both timestamps extrapolated.  [1] As long as there's Chrome past performance to extrapolate based on.

cols.name: vsync_interval
cols.desc: The VSync interval that this frame was produced for according to the BeginFrameArgs.

cols.name: begin_frame_ts
cols.desc: The begin frame timestamp, at which this frame started, according to the BeginFrameArgs.

cols.name: presentation_ts
cols.desc: The presentation timestamp of the frame.  * If `damage_type` is 'DAMAGING', then `presentation_ts` is the actual presentation timestamp. * If `damage_type` is 'NON_DAMAGING_WITH_EXTRAPOLATED_PRESENTATION_TIMESTAMP', then `presentation_ts` is an extrapolated timestamp based on the begin frame → presentation duration of the most recent damaging frame. * If `damage_type` is 'NON_DAMAGING_WITHOUT_EXTRAPOLATED_PRESENTATION_TIMESTAMP', then `presentation_ts` is NULL.

data_objects.name: chrome_scroll_jank_v4_reasons
data_objects.desc:
Reasons why the Scroll Jank V4 metric marked frames as janky.

 A frame might be janky for multiple reasons, so this table might contain
 multiple rows with the same `id` and distinct `jank_reason`s.

 Available since Chrome 145.0.7573.0 and cherry-picked into 144.0.7559.31.
data_objects.summary_desc: Reasons why the Scroll Jank V4 metric marked frames as janky

cols.name: id
cols.desc: Slice ID of the 'ScrollJankV4' slice. Can be joined with `chrome_scroll_jank_v4_results.id`.

cols.name: jank_reason
cols.desc: A reason why the frame is janky. Possible values:  * 'MISSED_VSYNC_DUE_TO_DECELERATING_INPUT_FRAME_DELIVERY': Chrome's input→frame delivery slowed down to the point that it missed one or more VSyncs. * 'MISSED_VSYNC_DURING_FAST_SCROLL': Chrome missed one or more VSyncs in the middle of a fast regular scroll. * 'MISSED_VSYNC_AT_START_OF_FLING': Chrome missed one or more VSyncs during the transition from a fast regular scroll to a fling. * 'MISSED_VSYNC_DURING_FLING': Chrome missed one or more VSyncs in the middle of a fling.

cols.name: missed_vsyncs
cols.desc: Number of VSyncs that that Chrome missed (for `jank_reason`) before presenting the first scroll update in the frame. Greater than zero.

data_objects.name: chrome_speedometer_measure
data_objects.desc:
Augmented slices for Speedometer measurements.
 These are the intervals of time Speedometer uses to compute the final score.
 There are two intervals that are measured for every test: sync and async
data_objects.summary_desc: Augmented slices for Speedometer measurements

cols.name: ts
cols.desc: Start timestamp of the measure slice

cols.name: dur
cols.desc: Duration of the measure slice

cols.name: name
cols.desc: Full measure name

cols.name: iteration
cols.desc: Speedometer iteration the slice belongs to.

cols.name: suite_name
cols.desc: Suite name

cols.name: test_name
cols.desc: Test name

cols.name: measure_type
cols.desc: Type of the measure (sync or async)

data_objects.name: chrome_speedometer_iteration
data_objects.desc:
Slice that covers one Speedometer iteration.
 Depending on the Speedometer version these slices might need to be estimated
 as older versions of Speedometer to not emit marks for this interval. The
 metrics associated are the same ones Speedometer would output, but note we
 use ns precision (Speedometer uses ~100us) so the actual values might differ
 a bit.
data_objects.summary_desc: Slice that covers one Speedometer iteration

cols.name: ts
cols.desc: Start timestamp of the iteration

cols.name: dur
cols.desc: Duration of the iteration

cols.name: name
cols.desc: Iteration name

cols.name: iteration
cols.desc: Iteration number

cols.name: geomean
cols.desc: Geometric mean of the suite durations for this iteration.

cols.name: score
cols.desc: Speedometer score for this iteration (The total score for a run in the average of all iteration scores).

functions.name: chrome_speedometer_score
functions.desc: Returns the Speedometer score for all iterations in the trace
functions.summary_desc: Returns the Speedometer score for all iterations in the trace

functions.name: chrome_speedometer_renderer_main_utid
functions.desc: Returns the utid for the main thread that ran Speedometer 3
functions.summary_desc: Returns the utid for the main thread that ran Speedometer 3

data_objects.name: chrome_page_loads
data_objects.desc: Chrome page loads, including associated high-level metrics and properties.
data_objects.summary_desc: Chrome page loads, including associated high-level metrics and properties

cols.name: id
cols.desc: ID of the navigation and Chrome browser process; this combination is unique to every individual navigation.

cols.name: navigation_id
cols.desc: ID of the navigation associated with the page load (i.e. the cross-document navigation in primary main frame which created this page's main document). Also note that navigation_id is specific to a given Chrome browser process, and not globally unique.

cols.name: navigation_start_ts
cols.desc: Timestamp of the start of navigation.

cols.name: fcp
cols.desc: Duration between the navigation start and the first contentful paint event (web.dev/fcp).

cols.name: fcp_ts
cols.desc: Timestamp of the first contentful paint.

cols.name: lcp
cols.desc: Duration between the navigation start and the largest contentful paint event (web.dev/lcp).

cols.name: lcp_ts
cols.desc: Timestamp of the largest contentful paint.

cols.name: dom_content_loaded_event_ts
cols.desc: Timestamp of the DomContentLoaded event: https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/Document/DOMContentLoaded_event

cols.name: load_event_ts
cols.desc: Timestamp of the window load event: https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/Window/load_event

cols.name: mark_fully_loaded_ts
cols.desc: Timestamp of the page self-reporting as fully loaded through the performance.mark('mark_fully_loaded') API.

cols.name: mark_fully_visible_ts
cols.desc: Timestamp of the page self-reporting as fully visible through the performance.mark('mark_fully_visible') API.

cols.name: mark_interactive_ts
cols.desc: Timestamp of the page self-reporting as fully interactive through the performance.mark('mark_interactive') API.

cols.name: url
cols.desc: URL at the page load event.

cols.name: browser_upid
cols.desc: The unique process id (upid) of the browser process where the page load occurred.

data_objects.name: chrome_touch_move_to_scroll_update
data_objects.desc:
Each scroll update event (except flings) in Chrome starts its life as a touch
 move event, which is then eventually converted to a scroll update itself.
 Each of these events is represented by its own LatencyInfo. This table
 contains a mapping between touch move events and scroll update events they
 were converted into.
data_objects.summary_desc: Each scroll update event (except flings) in Chrome starts its life as a touch  move event, which is then eventually converted to a scroll update itself

cols.name: touch_move_latency_id

cols.name: scroll_update_latency_id
cols.desc: Latency id of the corresponding scroll update input (LatencyInfo).

modules.data_check_sql: SELECT EXISTS(SELECT 1 FROM slice WHERE category GLOB '*toplevel*' AND (name = 'ThreadControllerImpl::RunTask' OR name = 'ThreadPool_RunTask') LIMIT 1) AS has_data

data_objects.name: chrome_scroll_frame_info_v4
data_objects.desc:
A list of all presented Chrome frames which contain scroll updates together
 with additional metadata, pipeline stages breakdown and jank classification
 according to the scroll model of Chrome's scroll jank v4 metric.
data_objects.summary_desc: A list of all presented Chrome frames which contain scroll updates together  with additional metadata, pipeline stages breakdown and jank classification  according to the scroll model of Chrome's scroll jank v4 metric

cols.name: id
cols.desc: Slice ID of the 'ScrollJankV4' slice, which represents a frame presented by Chrome that contains at least one scroll update. Can be joined with `chrome_scroll_jank_v4_results.id`.

cols.name: scroll_update_latency_id
cols.desc: Id of the `LatencyInfo.Flow` slices corresponding to the first scroll update in this frame. Can be joined with `chrome_gesture_scroll_updates.id`, `chrome_scroll_update_info.id`, `chrome_scroll_update_refs.scroll_update_latency_id` and many other tables.

cols.name: scroll_id
cols.desc: Id of the scroll this frame belongs to. Can be joined with `chrome_event_latency.scroll_id`.

cols.name: vsync_interval_dur
cols.desc: The VSync interval that this frame was produced for according to the BeginFrameArgs.

cols.name: is_janky
cols.desc: Whether this frame is janky based on the `Event.ScrollJank.DelayedFramesPercentage4.FixedWindow` metric.

cols.name: is_inertial
cols.desc: Whether the corresponding scroll is inertial (fling).

cols.name: frame_index_in_scroll
cols.desc: The position of the frame in a scroll (starting from 1).

cols.name: real_abs_total_raw_delta_pixels
cols.desc: The absolute total raw (unpredicted) delta of all real scroll updates included in this frame (in pixels). NULL if the first scroll update in this frame is synthetic.

cols.name: browser_uptime_dur
cols.desc: Duration from the start of the browser process to the input generation timestamp of the first scroll update in this frame. NULL if the first scroll update in this frame is synthetic.

cols.name: first_input_generation_ts
cols.desc: Input generation timestamp (from the Android system) for the first scroll update in this frame. NULL if the first scroll update in this frame is synthetic.

cols.name: input_reader_dur
cols.desc: Duration from the generation timestamp to the end of InputReader's work. Only populated when atrace 'input' category is enabled. NULL if the first scroll update is synthetic.

cols.name: input_dispatcher_dur
cols.desc: Duration of InputDispatcher's work. Only populated when atrace 'input' category is enabled. NULL if the first scroll update in this frame is synthetic.

cols.name: previous_last_input_to_first_input_generation_dur
cols.desc: Duration from the previous input (last input that wasn't part of this frame) to the first input in this frame.

cols.name: browser_utid
cols.desc: Utid for the browser main thread, on which Chrome received the first scroll update in this frame. NULL if the first scroll update in this frame is synthetic.

cols.name: first_input_generation_to_browser_main_dur
cols.desc: Duration from input generation to when the browser received the first scroll update in this frame. NULL if the first scroll update in this frame is synthetic.

cols.name: first_input_generation_to_browser_main_delta_dur
cols.desc: Difference between `first_input_generation_to_browser_main_dur` for this frame and the previous frame in the same scroll. NULL if the first scroll update in either frame is synthetic.

cols.name: first_input_touch_move_received_slice_id
cols.desc: Slice id for the `STEP_SEND_INPUT_EVENT_UI` slice for the `TouchMove` event associated with the first scroll update in this frame. NULL if the first scroll update in this frame is synthetic.

cols.name: first_input_touch_move_received_ts
cols.desc: Timestamp for the `STEP_SEND_INPUT_EVENT_UI` slice for the `TouchMove` event associated with the first scroll update in this frame. NULL if the first scroll update in this frame is synthetic.

cols.name: first_input_touch_move_processing_dur
cols.desc: Duration for processing the `TouchMove` event associated with the first scroll update in this frame. NULL if the first scroll update in this frame is synthetic.

cols.name: first_input_touch_move_processing_delta_dur
cols.desc: Difference between `first_input_touch_move_processing_dur` for this frame and the previous frame in the same scroll. NULL if the first scroll update in either frame is synthetic.

cols.name: first_input_scroll_update_created_slice_id
cols.desc: Slice id for the `STEP_SEND_INPUT_EVENT_UI` slice which created the `GestureScrollUpdate` event from the `TouchMove` event for the first scroll update in this frame. NULL if the first scroll update in this frame is synthetic.

cols.name: first_input_scroll_update_created_ts
cols.desc: Timestamp for the `STEP_SEND_INPUT_EVENT_UI` slice which created the `GestureScrollUpdate` event from the `TouchMove` event for the first scroll update in this frame. NULL if the first scroll update in this frame is synthetic.

cols.name: first_input_scroll_update_processing_dur
cols.desc: Duration for creating the `GestureScrollUpdate` event from the `TouchMove` event for the first scroll update in this frame. NULL if the first scroll update in this frame is synthetic.

cols.name: first_input_scroll_update_processing_delta_dur
cols.desc: Difference between `first_input_scroll_update_processing_dur` for this frame and the previous frame in the same scroll. NULL if the first scroll update in either frame is synthetic.

cols.name: first_input_scroll_update_created_end_ts
cols.desc: End timestamp for the `STEP_SEND_INPUT_EVENT_UI` slice which created the `GestureScrollUpdate` event from the `TouchMove` event for the first scroll update in this frame. NULL if the first scroll update in this frame is synthetic.

cols.name: first_input_browser_to_compositor_delay_dur
cols.desc: Duration between the browser and compositor dispatch for the first scroll update in this frame. NULL if the first scroll update in this frame is synthetic.

cols.name: first_input_browser_to_compositor_delay_delta_dur
cols.desc: Difference between `first_input_browser_to_compositor_delay_dur` for this frame and the previous frame in the same scroll. NULL if either scroll update in this frame is synthetic.

cols.name: compositor_utid
cols.desc: Utid for the renderer compositor thread.

cols.name: first_input_compositor_dispatch_slice_id
cols.desc: Slice id for the `STEP_HANDLE_INPUT_EVENT_IMPL` slice associated with the first scroll update in this frame.

cols.name: first_input_compositor_dispatch_ts
cols.desc: Timestamp for the `STEP_HANDLE_INPUT_EVENT_IMPL` slice associated with the first scroll update in this frame or the containing task (if available).

cols.name: first_input_compositor_dispatch_dur
cols.desc: Duration for the compositor dispatch for the first scroll update in this frame.

cols.name: first_input_compositor_dispatch_delta_dur
cols.desc: Difference between `first_input_compositor_dispatch_dur` for this frame and the previous frame in the same scroll.

cols.name: first_input_compositor_dispatch_end_ts
cols.desc: End timestamp for the `STEP_HANDLE_INPUT_EVENT_IMPL` slice associated with the first scroll update in this frame.

cols.name: first_input_compositor_dispatch_to_on_begin_frame_delay_dur
cols.desc: Duration between the compositor dispatch and the "OnBeginFrame" work for the first input in this frame. NULL if this frame is non-damaging.

cols.name: first_input_compositor_dispatch_to_on_begin_frame_delay_delta_dur
cols.desc: Difference between `first_input_compositor_dispatch_to_on_begin_frame_delay_dur` for this frame and the previous frame in the same scroll. NULL if either frame is non-damaging.

cols.name: compositor_resample_slice_id
cols.desc: Slice id for the `STEP_RESAMPLE_SCROLL_EVENTS` slice. NULL if this frame is non-damaging.

cols.name: compositor_coalesced_input_handled_slice_id
cols.desc: Slice id for the `STEP_DID_HANDLE_INPUT_AND_OVERSCROLL` slice. NULL if this frame is non-damaging.

cols.name: compositor_on_begin_frame_ts
cols.desc: Start timestamp for work done on the input during "OnBeginFrame". NULL if this frame is non-damaging.

cols.name: compositor_on_begin_frame_dur
cols.desc: Duration of the "OnBeginFrame" work for this frame. NULL if this frame is non-damaging.

cols.name: compositor_on_begin_frame_delta_dur
cols.desc: Difference between `compositor_on_begin_frame_dur` for this frame and the previous frame in the same scroll. NULL if either frame is non-damaging.

cols.name: compositor_on_begin_frame_end_ts
cols.desc: End timestamp for work done on the input during "OnBeginFrame". NULL if this frame is non-damaging.

cols.name: compositor_on_begin_frame_to_generation_delay_dur
cols.desc: Duration between the "OnBeginFrame" work and the generation of this frame. NULL if this frame is non-damaging.

cols.name: compositor_on_begin_frame_to_generation_delay_delta_dur
cols.desc: Difference between `compositor_on_begin_frame_to_generation_delay_dur` for this frame and the previous frame in the same scroll. NULL if either frame is non-damaging.

cols.name: compositor_generate_compositor_frame_slice_id
cols.desc: Slice id for the `STEP_GENERATE_COMPOSITOR_FRAME` slice. NULL if this frame is non-damaging.

cols.name: compositor_generate_compositor_frame_ts
cols.desc: Timestamp for the `STEP_GENERATE_COMPOSITOR_FRAME` slice or the containing task (if available). NULL if this frame is non-damaging.

cols.name: compositor_generate_frame_to_submit_frame_dur
cols.desc: Duration between the generation and submission of this frame. NULL if this frame is non-damaging.

cols.name: compositor_generate_frame_to_submit_frame_delta_dur
cols.desc: Difference between `compositor_generate_frame_to_submit_frame_dur` for this frame and the previous frame in the same scroll. NULL if either frame is non-damaging.

cols.name: compositor_submit_compositor_frame_slice_id
cols.desc: Slice id for the `STEP_SUBMIT_COMPOSITOR_FRAME` slice. NULL if this frame is non-damaging.

cols.name: compositor_submit_compositor_frame_ts
cols.desc: Timestamp for the `STEP_SUBMIT_COMPOSITOR_FRAME` slice. NULL if this frame is non-damaging.

cols.name: compositor_submit_frame_dur
cols.desc: Duration for submitting this frame. NULL if this frame is non-damaging.

cols.name: compositor_submit_frame_delta_dur
cols.desc: Difference between `compositor_submit_frame_dur` for this frame and the previous frame in the same scroll. NULL if either frame is non-damaging.

cols.name: compositor_submit_compositor_frame_end_ts
cols.desc: End timestamp for the `STEP_SUBMIT_COMPOSITOR_FRAME` slice. NULL if this frame is non-damaging.

cols.name: viz_compositor_utid
cols.desc: Utid for the viz compositor thread. NULL if this frame is non-damaging.

cols.name: compositor_to_viz_delay_dur
cols.desc: Delay when a compositor frame is sent from the renderer to viz. NULL if this frame is non-damaging.

cols.name: compositor_to_viz_delay_delta_dur
cols.desc: Difference between `compositor_to_viz_delay_dur` for this frame and the previous frame in the same scroll. NULL if either frame is non-damaging.

cols.name: viz_receive_compositor_frame_slice_id
cols.desc: Slice id for the `STEP_RECEIVE_COMPOSITOR_FRAME` slice. NULL if this frame is non-damaging.

cols.name: viz_receive_compositor_frame_ts
cols.desc: Timestamp for the `STEP_RECEIVE_COMPOSITOR_FRAME` slice or the containing task (if available). NULL if this frame is non-damaging.

cols.name: viz_receive_compositor_frame_dur
cols.desc: Duration of the viz work done on receiving the compositor frame. NULL if this frame is non-damaging.

cols.name: viz_receive_compositor_frame_delta_dur
cols.desc: Difference between `viz_receive_compositor_frame_dur` for this frame and the previous frame in the same scroll. NULL if either frame is non-damaging.

cols.name: viz_receive_compositor_frame_end_ts
cols.desc: End timestamp for the `STEP_RECEIVE_COMPOSITOR_FRAME` slice. NULL if this frame is non-damaging.

cols.name: viz_wait_for_draw_dur
cols.desc: Duration between viz receiving the compositor frame to frame draw. NULL if this frame is non-damaging.

cols.name: viz_wait_for_draw_delta_dur
cols.desc: Difference between `viz_wait_for_draw_dur` for this frame and the previous frame in the same scroll. NULL if either frame is non-damaging.

cols.name: viz_draw_and_swap_slice_id
cols.desc: Slice id for the `STEP_DRAW_AND_SWAP` slice. NULL if this frame is non-damaging.

cols.name: viz_draw_and_swap_ts
cols.desc: Timestamp for the `STEP_DRAW_AND_SWAP` slice or the containing task (if available). NULL if this frame is non-damaging.

cols.name: viz_draw_and_swap_dur
cols.desc: Duration of the viz drawing/swapping work for this frame. NULL if this frame is non-damaging.

cols.name: viz_draw_and_swap_delta_dur
cols.desc: Difference between `viz_draw_and_swap_dur` for this frame and the previous frame in the same scroll. NULL if either frame is non-damaging.

cols.name: viz_send_buffer_swap_slice_id
cols.desc: Slice id for the `STEP_SEND_BUFFER_SWAP` slice. NULL if this frame is non-damaging.

cols.name: viz_send_buffer_swap_end_ts
cols.desc: End timestamp for the `STEP_SEND_BUFFER_SWAP` slice. NULL if this frame is non-damaging.

cols.name: viz_gpu_thread_utid
cols.desc: Utid for the viz `CompositorGpuThread`. NULL if this frame is non-damaging.

cols.name: viz_to_gpu_delay_dur
cols.desc: Delay between viz work on compositor thread and `CompositorGpuThread`. NULL if this frame is non-damaging.

cols.name: viz_to_gpu_delay_delta_dur
cols.desc: Difference between `viz_to_gpu_delay_dur` for this frame and the previous frame in the same scroll. NULL if either frame is non-damaging.

cols.name: viz_swap_buffers_slice_id
cols.desc: Slice id for the `STEP_BUFFER_SWAP_POST_SUBMIT` slice. NULL if this frame is non-damaging.

cols.name: viz_swap_buffers_ts
cols.desc: Timestamp for the `STEP_BUFFER_SWAP_POST_SUBMIT` slice or the containing task (if available). NULL if this frame is non-damaging.

cols.name: viz_swap_buffers_dur
cols.desc: Duration of frame buffer swapping work on viz. NULL if this frame is non-damaging.

cols.name: viz_swap_buffers_delta_dur
cols.desc: Difference between `viz_swap_buffers_dur` for this frame and the previous frame in the same scroll. NULL if either frame is non-damaging.

cols.name: viz_swap_buffers_end_ts
cols.desc: End timestamp for the `STEP_BUFFER_SWAP_POST_SUBMIT` slice. NULL if this frame is non-damaging.

cols.name: viz_swap_buffers_to_latch_dur
cols.desc: Time between buffers ready until Choreographer's latch. NULL if this frame is non-damaging.

cols.name: viz_swap_buffers_to_latch_delta_dur
cols.desc: Difference between `viz_swap_buffers_to_latch_dur` for this frame and the previous frame in the same scroll. NULL if either frame is non-damaging.

cols.name: latch_timestamp
cols.desc: Timestamp for `EventLatency`'s `LatchToSwapEnd` step. NULL if this frame is non-damaging.

cols.name: viz_latch_to_presentation_dur
cols.desc: Duration between Choreographer's latch and presentation. NULL if this frame is non-damaging.

cols.name: viz_latch_to_presentation_delta_dur
cols.desc: Difference between `viz_latch_to_presentation_dur` for this frame and the previous frame in the same scroll. NULL if either frame is non-damaging.

cols.name: presentation_ts
cols.desc: Presentation timestamp for the frame. NULL if this frame is non-damaging.

   * STEP_GENERATE_COMPOSITOR_FRAME

   * STEP_DID_NOT_PRODUCE_FRAME
   * STEP_DID_NOT_PRODUCE_COMPOSITOR_FRAME
